name: Data Center Consolidation
description: Consolidate multiple data centers into fewer, more efficient facilities. Migrate non-critical workloads to cloud infrastructure. Reduce power, cooling, and real estate costs.
examples: Microsoft-LinkedIn consolidated data centers saving $500M over 3 years. Salesforce-Slack achieved $400M in infrastructure savings.
sources: McKinsey M&A Report 2023, BCG IT Synergies Study 2022

name: Software License Rationalization
description: Consolidate overlapping software licenses across merged entities. Negotiate enterprise agreements. Eliminate redundant tools.
examples: Typical M&A deals achieve 15-25% reduction in software spend. Adobe-Marketo reduced licenses by 22%.

name: IT Headcount Optimization
description: Eliminate duplicate IT roles (helpdesk, infrastructure, security). Create shared services model. Optimize span of control.
examples: Oracle-PeopleSoft reduced IT headcount by 18%. Dell-EMC consolidated IT teams saving $800M annually.

name: Cloud Migration Acceleration
description: Accelerate cloud migration to eliminate on-premise infrastructure. Leverage combined scale for better cloud pricing.
examples: Capital One saved $2.8B through cloud migration. Netflix eliminated all data centers.

name: Network Infrastructure Consolidation
description: Consolidate WAN, LAN, and telecom contracts. Eliminate redundant circuits. Renegotiate with combined volume.
examples: Typical savings of 20-30% on telecom spend. Verizon-Yahoo achieved $500M in network savings.

name: Cybersecurity Platform Consolidation
description: Consolidate security tools (SIEM, EDR, firewalls). Eliminate duplicate security teams. Create unified SOC.
examples: Bank of America-Merrill Lynch consolidated security operations saving $300M. JPMorgan-Chase integrated cyber teams.

name: ERP System Consolidation
description: Migrate to single ERP platform (SAP, Oracle, or Microsoft). Eliminate duplicate finance, HR, supply chain systems.
examples: Kraft-Heinz consolidated to single SAP instance. Anheuser-Busch InBev unified ERP across 50 countries.

name: Application Portfolio Rationalization
description: Identify and retire redundant applications. Consolidate overlapping functionality. Move to SaaS where possible.
examples: Typical companies reduce application count by 25-40% post-merger. GE reduced apps from 9000 to 2000.

name: IT Service Desk Consolidation
description: Merge IT helpdesks into single organization. Implement unified ticketing system. Offshore tier-1 support.
examples: IBM-Red Hat consolidated service desks. HP-Compaq merged helpdesk operations saving $150M.

name: DevOps Toolchain Standardization
description: Standardize on single CI/CD platform, monitoring tools, and deployment practices. Share engineering best practices.
examples: Google-Fitbit standardized on Google Cloud Platform. Microsoft-GitHub unified DevOps practices.

name: Benefits Plan Harmonization
description: Standardize health, dental, and vision plans. Negotiate better rates with combined employee base. Eliminate duplicate plans.
examples: United-Continental saved $200M on benefits. Delta-Northwest harmonized benefits for 80,000 employees.

name: HR Shared Services Center
description: Consolidate HR transactional activities (payroll, recruiting, onboarding) into shared services center. Reduce HR-to-employee ratio.
examples: P&G consolidated HR operations saving $400M. Cisco created global HR shared services.

name: HRIS System Consolidation
description: Migrate to single HR information system (Workday, Oracle, SAP SuccessFactors). Eliminate duplicate HR tech stack.
examples: ADP-Celergo consolidated HR systems. Ultimate Software-Kronos unified platforms.

name: Talent Retention Programs
description: Implement retention bonuses, career development programs, and culture integration to prevent key talent loss.
examples: Google retained 95% of key Nest employees. Facebook retained 89% of Instagram team.

name: Recruiting Process Optimization
description: Consolidate recruiting teams. Negotiate better rates with staffing agencies. Implement unified ATS platform.
examples: LinkedIn reduced recruiting costs by 30% post-acquisition. Indeed consolidated ATS platforms.

name: Training and Development Consolidation
description: Combine L&D programs, eliminate duplicate courses, leverage shared learning platforms.
examples: AT&T-DirecTV consolidated training programs. Marriott-Starwood unified leadership development.

name: Compensation Structure Harmonization
description: Standardize salary bands, bonus structures, and equity compensation. Eliminate pay disparities.
examples: Wells Fargo-Wachovia harmonized compensation saving $250M. Bank of America standardized pay structures.

name: Performance Management System Integration
description: Adopt single performance review process, goals framework, and rating system across merged organization.
examples: Microsoft unified performance systems across acquisitions. GE standardized performance management.

name: AP/AR Process Consolidation
description: Consolidate accounts payable and receivable operations. Eliminate duplicate invoice processing. Automate workflows.
examples: Johnson & Johnson consolidated AP/AR saving $180M. P&G automated invoice processing.

name: Treasury Operations Optimization
description: Consolidate bank accounts, optimize cash management, improve working capital, negotiate better banking fees.
examples: GE Capital optimized treasury operations saving $300M. Apple improved working capital by $2B.

name: Financial Systems Consolidation
description: Migrate to single general ledger, consolidation, and reporting platform. Eliminate duplicate finance systems.
examples: Oracle-NetSuite consolidated finance platforms. SAP-Concur integrated expense systems.

name: Tax Structure Optimization
description: Optimize legal entity structure, transfer pricing, and tax jurisdictions. Reduce effective tax rate.
examples: Pfizer-Allergan tax inversion (later abandoned). Medtronic optimized tax structure saving $800M annually.

name: Financial Planning & Analysis Integration
description: Consolidate FP&A teams, standardize planning processes, adopt unified budgeting platform.
examples: IBM unified FP&A across acquisitions. Salesforce standardized planning processes.

name: Audit and Compliance Consolidation
description: Consolidate internal audit functions, reduce external audit fees, streamline SOX compliance.
examples: JPMorgan-Bear Stearns consolidated audit functions. Wells Fargo reduced external audit costs by 25%.

name: Expense Management System Integration
description: Consolidate expense reporting platforms (Concur, Expensify), standardize policies, reduce processing costs.
examples: Amazon standardized on Concur globally. Google consolidated expense systems across acquisitions.

name: Working Capital Optimization
description: Optimize Days Sales Outstanding, Days Payable Outstanding, and inventory turns. Free up cash.
examples: Dell revolutionized working capital management. Apple optimized to negative cash conversion cycle.

name: Procurement Leverage
description: Combine purchasing power for indirect spend. Negotiate better rates with suppliers using combined volume.
examples: Staples-Office Depot achieved $1B in procurement savings (merger blocked). Amazon leverages scale globally.

name: Cross-Selling to Existing Customers
description: Sell acquirer's products to target's customers and vice versa. Bundle offerings for higher wallet share.
examples: Microsoft cross-sold Office to LinkedIn users. Salesforce cross-sold to Slack customers adding $500M revenue.

name: Sales Territory Optimization
description: Eliminate overlapping sales territories. Optimize coverage ratios. Reduce sales headcount in redundant regions.
examples: Oracle-PeopleSoft consolidated sales teams. SAP-Business Objects optimized territories.

name: CRM Platform Consolidation
description: Migrate to single CRM platform (Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, HubSpot). Gain unified customer view.
examples: Verizon-Yahoo consolidated CRM systems. AT&T unified sales platforms across acquisitions.

name: Sales Compensation Alignment
description: Standardize sales compensation plans, quota setting, and commission structures. Reduce overpayment.
examples: IBM standardized sales comp globally. Oracle unified commission structures across divisions.

name: Channel Partner Rationalization
description: Consolidate channel partner programs. Eliminate channel conflict. Offer combined product portfolio.
examples: Cisco-Meraki rationalized channel programs. Dell-EMC unified partner ecosystem.

name: Pricing Strategy Harmonization
description: Standardize pricing methodology. Eliminate value-destructive discounting. Improve price realization.
examples: United-Continental harmonized pricing adding $800M revenue. Airlines historically achieve 2-5% price improvement.

name: Manufacturing Footprint Optimization
description: Consolidate redundant manufacturing facilities. Optimize production allocation. Close underutilized plants.
examples: Kraft-Heinz closed 7 factories saving $1.5B. Dow-DuPont optimized footprint saving $3B.

name: Supply Chain Network Optimization
description: Consolidate distribution centers. Optimize inventory positioning. Reduce transportation costs.
examples: Amazon optimized fulfillment network. Walmart-Jet.com consolidated distribution saving $500M.

name: Procurement and Sourcing Consolidation
description: Consolidate supplier base. Negotiate volume discounts. Standardize on preferred suppliers.
examples: Anheuser-Busch InBev achieved $2.8B procurement savings. P&G consolidated to 75,000 suppliers from 100,000.

name: Logistics and Transportation Optimization
description: Consolidate shipping contracts. Optimize load factors. Reduce empty miles. Leverage combined volume.
examples: XPO Logistics achieved synergies through route optimization. FedEx-TNT consolidated networks.

name: Quality Management System Integration
description: Standardize quality processes, inspection protocols, and compliance systems. Share best practices.
examples: Toyota standardized quality systems globally. Johnson & Johnson unified quality management.

name: Facilities and Real Estate Consolidation
description: Consolidate office locations. Sublease excess space. Renegotiate leases with combined footprint.
examples: Wells Fargo-Wachovia consolidated 10% of branches saving $900M. HP-Compaq reduced real estate by 30%.

name: Environmental Health & Safety Integration
description: Standardize EHS policies, training programs, and incident reporting. Reduce insurance premiums.
examples: Dow Chemical integrated EHS systems. BASF standardized safety protocols globally.

name: Contract Management Consolidation
description: Consolidate contract management systems. Standardize templates. Reduce external counsel spend.
examples: GE consolidated contract systems. Microsoft standardized contract templates globally.

name: Legal Entity Rationalization
description: Eliminate redundant legal entities. Simplify corporate structure. Reduce regulatory filing requirements.
examples: IBM reduced legal entities from 2000 to 700. P&G simplified structure saving $50M annually.

name: Intellectual Property Portfolio Optimization
description: Consolidate patent and trademark portfolios. Eliminate duplicate IP. Optimize maintenance fees.
examples: Google optimized patent portfolio post-acquisitions. IBM reduced patent maintenance costs by 30%.

name: Compliance Program Integration
description: Consolidate compliance functions (AML, KYC, data privacy). Adopt unified compliance platform.
examples: Bank of America integrated compliance post-Merrill Lynch. JPMorgan unified AML systems.

name: Litigation Management Consolidation
description: Consolidate litigation management, e-discovery platforms, and outside counsel panel.
examples: Verizon consolidated legal operations. AT&T standardized litigation management.

name: R&D Facility Consolidation
description: Consolidate research labs and development centers. Share equipment and infrastructure.
examples: Pfizer-Wyeth consolidated R&D sites saving $1.2B. Merck reduced facilities by 30%.

name: Product Roadmap Rationalization
description: Eliminate overlapping product initiatives. Focus investment on high-potential projects. Kill redundant programs.
examples: Microsoft rationalized product portfolio post-Nokia. Google consolidated messaging apps (finally!).

name: Clinical Trial Consolidation
description: Consolidate clinical trial operations. Share CRO contracts. Optimize site selection.
examples: Bristol-Myers Squibb-Celgene optimized clinical operations. Novartis consolidated trial management.

name: Innovation Process Standardization
description: Adopt common stage-gate process, innovation metrics, and portfolio management approach.
examples: 3M standardized innovation globally. P&G unified stage-gate process across divisions.

name: Technology Platform Consolidation
description: Consolidate onto common technology platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). Share engineering infrastructure.
examples: Salesforce migrated acquisitions to core platform. Adobe unified on AWS infrastructure.
